conclusion: Determine the magnitude of the Ampere force acting on the current-carrying wire.
The wire is in the shape of an 'L,' with segments ac and cd.
The current flows from a to c and then from c to d.
The magnetic field B is perpendicular to the plane of the wire.
Calculate the force on segment ac: F_ac = I * L * B.
Calculate the force on segment cd: F_cd = I * 2L * B.
Determine the total force: F_total = I * B * (L + 2L) = I * B * 3L.
The magnitude of the Ampere force acting on the current-carrying wire is 3I * L * B.
